com.bruceslawson.ratelimiter

Class RateLimiterMemcache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bruceslawson.ratelimiter.RateLimiter
      • com.bruceslawson.ratelimiter.RateLimiterMemcache

  • public class RateLimiterMemcache
extends RateLimiter
    Basic implementation of a rolling rate limiter that uses memcahed as the storage mechanism. If no memcached servers are specified it will check locally (127.0.0.1) on port 11211.

    Uses memcache expiration times to clean up old slices.

    To start memcached with debug info and on default port 11211:

    shell> ./memcached -vv

    Example usage:

    RateLimiter limiter = new RateLimiterMemcache(6, 5*60, 5, false);
    boolean isThisKeyLimited = limiter.isLimited("username@domain.com");

    Author:
    Bruce Slawson <bruce@bruceslawson.com>

      • RateLimiterMemcache

        public RateLimiterMemcache(long rateLimit,
                   long ratePeriodSeconds,
                   int numberOfSlices,
                   boolean isDebug,
                   java.net.InetSocketAddress... memcachedServers)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Construct the rate limiter.
        Parameters:
        rateLimit - The counts limit allowed in ratePeriodSeconds time.
        ratePeriodSeconds - The rolling period of time to check count.
        numberOfSlices - The granularity of time within ratePeriodSeconds.
        isDebug - Set debugging on or off.
        memcachedServers - The memcached servers
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public boolean isLimited(java.lang.String limiterKey,
